poem:
**Holiday Parking**  

The lot stretches wide—  
a concrete field,  
where dreams of flight  
linger and pause.  

Metal beasts rest,  
capped in dust,  
as time stamps  
an hourly toll.  

Park early, book well,  
the whispers of travel betray  
as planes etch the sky—  
an arc of departure.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "UK airport parking: how to drive down the cost on your summer holiday Book early How much airport parking will cost you depends on several factors – when you book; how close to the airport you want to be; how you book; how long your vehicle will stay in the car park; and which airport you are flying from. Prices vary widely between different airports. According to figures from the comparison website Confused.com, the average". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
